blog.description:
I write fic and I make aesthetic boards. My Ao3 library currently includes:
The Exorcist
Pacific Rim
Fantastic Beasts
Hannibal
Star Trek
and others.
The aesthetics, however, are for all sorts of things. I don't post here too often but I'm online every day and my inbox is always open!

summary: Blessings of the Traveller “As he sits down in his chair, I would ask each of you to please describe yourselves, starting with...
caption:
Blessings of the Traveller

“As he sits down in his chair, I would ask each of you to please describe yourselves, starting with you, Laura.”

“Oh, well, okay. I’m just, you know, a little blue tiefling, that’s all. With blue hair. And I’m wearing a pretty cute dress, that’s all. And I’m having a good time, you know? We’re just having a good time, here at breakfast.”

summary: I am the Parent. You Do Understand That, Correct? “As your smaller friend curls awake... Sam, would you like to describe your...
caption:
I am the Parent. You Do Understand That, Correct?

“As your smaller friend curls awake… Sam, would you like to describe your character?”

“Uh, yeah. Um, I am… a little goblin girl.”

*general laughter*

“I am a… a goblin.”

*more laughter*

“So y’know, the green skin, the green hair, the yellow eyes. And uh, she wears not great clothes, just like here traveling companion there, um… she kind of hides in the shadows a lot ‘cause she knows that goblins aren’t kind of welcome in this part. And… that’s about it. I mean she’s a little skittish. And right now she’s probably stirring awake as well, right?”

“Uh, well, what’s your name?”

“Oh. Nott the Brave.”

“So Caleb, as you come to consciousness, you glance over and can see, slowly snoring and rousing at about the same time, Nott’s eyes blink open, her slowly groaning face looking over towards you.”

“Oh! You’re finally awake, I see!”

*more laughter*

“Oh yeah, motherfuckers! It’s on!”

blog.name: notsalony
blog.title: Notsalony's Haven
blog.description:
I'm a 33 year old bisexual polyamourus polytheist who loves to write, read, and am a listener by trade and skill. Welcome to my haven. You may know me from y gallery, ff.net, aff.net, a03, twitter, or a few other sites here and there.
Welcome to my haven. I also do paid commissioned works of writing.

summary:
So I have this fan theory / head cannon that preys on my
desire to make massive massively connected universes out of fandoms...
body:
So I have this fan theory / head cannon that preys on my desire to make massive massively connected universes out of fandoms using the tiniest little tidbits to feed in one another and I have a theory about your characters I’ve seen you role play on Geek and Sundry.

Here is my fan theory: At the end of “The Doctor Falls” John Simm’s master doesn’t regenerate into Missy, in fact he regenerates into your Master from the Eric’s TBD Doctor Who RPG, who at the end of his regeneration becomes Michelle Gomaz’s Missy who dies at the end of “The Doctor Falls”, a small piece of her surviving in a ring that a Demon Lord, Nocticula, discovers when the Mondasian Colony ship fell out of a black hole into another universe where it crashed into Exandria.  Nocticula gave the ring to a mortal man she fell in love with for a brief time named Lord Percival Fredrickstein Von Musel Klossowski de Roll III of Whitestone, a ring he would later melt down for part of his famous invention shortly after they made love.  This released the Master/Missy’s soul which was captured by Nocticula and she used it to birth the Tiefling Lucien to whom she released into the world of Exandria.

Lucien, a Tiefling who had the soul of a Time Lord in his body, grew only to discover later that his Time Lord heritage was corrupted by jumping realties and rebirth by demon, has resulted in the ability to regenerate his mind and personality but not changing his body.  This allows him to die to become Nonagon, and later die again to become Mollymauk Tealeaf, who was valiantly struck down by the Oni Lorenzo in “Found and Lost”. Who’s body was lain to rest in the North, which the Mighty Nein visited, with the Firbolg, Caduceus Clay who would later cast decompose upon Molly’s remains so that the earth would remember him.

Caduceus leaves on with the Mighty Nein, having many grand adventures till he eventually gets hit with a bolt of time magic when Caleb attempts to rewrite history, reacting with an unknown energy inside Caduceus that has always allowed him to interact with the world around him in an unusual way, launching him not just through time but space, landing him in the fountains at Cardiff Bay’s Mermaid Quay, above the Torchwood Hub on the rift.  He leaves the fountain only to find a London Punk version of the Master fresh from his journey on the USS Sally Ride in “The Madwoman in a Box” finds him and frowns, realizing he knows him somehow and realizes much like on the Mondasian Colony ship, he’s found a future version of himself.

Taking Caduceus in the TARDIS of Amy Dallen’s Doctor, they travel through the rift, using Sam de Leve’s Rokokokoko’s abilities to navigate to a point of convergence between The Master and Caduceus, arriving in a frost covered mountain side, just as a well known thief who Molly had stopped and helped twice before his death as Molly, has found the grave in the midst of a small forest where nature has been building a shrine of black roses around Molly’s grave.  They send the thief on his way, yet again confused by the kindness of strangers, only to turn and see puffs of artron energy seeping out of Molly’s grave, having arrived as he is reborn yet again, still the same lavender Tiefling but the same mind as well, thanks to Caduceus’ spell that shielded him from his normal damaged regeneration powers.

This leaves Caduceus to leave the TARDIS and explore the world with Molly, stopping at every tea shop and bath house in all of Exandria that they can find, till eventually, having reunited with their friends and told many tales of their wandering years, The Master returns and frowns at them again, every time they try to leave Exandria they keep getting through around in time and always in a different part of either Molly or Caduceus’ lives so they decide to try to take them with them to see if they can make it out.  This plan almost works but they end up stranded in the distant past.  Caduceus, realizing they are in the forest he grew up in but there is no sign of the temple his family has guarded all these years. He does discover a young Firbolg woman who is in need of rescuing.

Caduceus falls in love, marries the woman and realizes that they found the temple to the Wild Mother and form the graveyard that he grows up in a long time from now.  Molly goes off to find supplies to try to help The Master, The Doctor, and The Corsair fix the TARDIS but as soon as he was far enough away the TARDIS is sling shot back into its own universe and timeline leaving Molly trapped in the ancient past.  He decides to commission an ancient wizard to write spells that Caleb will hunt for later when as a young child in the academy he discovers a smutty story that also has randomly hidden and encoded spells that only he seems to be able to decipher stored within their pages putting him on a lifelong quest to hunt for obscure works of pornography.

Molly continues to regenerate into himself at every death wondering how long he’ll be stuck in the past like this, till he meets the loves of his life and settles down in the temple with Caduceus’ great grand children and live his polyamorus omnisexual hedonistic life till one day he gives his life, one last time, to save a Firbolg woman who reminds him so much of his long departed friend.  This time, as he fades, he sees she’s mortally wounded and instead of regenerating himself he regenerates the woman, connecting with the young life growing in her and realizing that this is Caduceus’ mother with her unborn son inside her.  Molly dies, saving the life of his next host / incarnation, casting a reincarnation spell he’d been saving just in case he got tired of his current form, so that Caduceus would be born fresh, with none of The Master, Missy, or Molly’s baggage.

Caduceus is born later, growing up not only an innocent but new and fresh to the world with an old soul that lets him see the world in a way no one else can, and his parents never tell him much about his favorite grave, and the man buried there who saved his life.  This is the same grave that he goes to when he meets the Mighty Nein when they ask him to leave his home, taking a piece of Molly with him as he travels with Molly’s former friends, not knowing him by that name as he’d changed it long before Caduceus’ parents were born.  And when he stops and inspects Molly’s grave he senses the same energy from the grave he left behind, understanding that something has happened, either this being the same person in two graves or figuring this is somehow a child of the man he owes his life to, he charms the grave so that the earth will remember him.  Never knowing until much later in his life that he’s just started and closed a loop of his own life that will result in his own birth farther down the line.

So I have this fan theory / head cannon that preys on my desire to make massive massively connected universes out of fandoms using the tiniest little tidbits to feed in one another and I have a theory about your characters I’ve seen you role play on Geek and Sundry.

Here is my fan theory: At the end of “The Doctor Falls” John Simm’s master doesn’t regenerate into Missy, in fact he regenerates into your Master from the Eric’s TBD Doctor Who RPG, who at the end of his regeneration becomes Michelle Gomaz’s Missy who dies at the end of “The Doctor Falls”, a small piece of her surviving in a ring that a Demon Lord, Nocticula, discovers when the Mondasian Colony ship fell out of a black hole into another universe where it crashed into Exandria.  Nocticula gave the ring to a mortal man she fell in love with for a brief time named Lord Percival Fredrickstein Von Musel Klossowski de Roll III of Whitestone, a ring he would later melt down for part of his famous invention shortly after they made love.  This released the Master/Missy’s soul which was captured by Nocticula and she used it to birth the Tiefling Lucien to whom she released into the world of Exandria.

Lucien, a Tiefling who had the soul of a Time Lord in his body, grew only to discover later that his Time Lord heritage was corrupted by jumping realties and rebirth by demon, has resulted in the ability to regenerate his mind and personality but not changing his body.  This allows him to die to become Nonagon, and later die again to become Mollymauk Tealeaf, who was valiantly struck down by the Oni Lorenzo in “Found and Lost”. Who’s body was lain to rest in the North, which the Mighty Nein visited, with the Firbolg, Caduceus Clay who would later cast decompose upon Molly’s remains so that the earth would remember him.

Caduceus leaves on with the Mighty Nein, having many grand adventures till he eventually gets hit with a bolt of time magic when Caleb attempts to rewrite history, reacting with an unknown energy inside Caduceus that has always allowed him to interact with the world around him in an unusual way, launching him not just through time but space, landing him in the fountains at Cardiff Bay’s Mermaid Quay, above the Torchwood Hub on the rift.  He leaves the fountain only to find a London Punk version of the Master fresh from his journey on the USS Sally Ride in “The Madwoman in a Box” finds him and frowns, realizing he knows him somehow and realizes much like on the Mondasian Colony ship, he’s found a future version of himself.

Taking Caduceus in the TARDIS of Amy Dallen’s Doctor, they travel through the rift, using Sam de Leve’s Rokokokoko’s abilities to navigate to a point of convergence between The Master and Caduceus, arriving in a frost covered mountain side, just as a well known thief who Molly had stopped and helped twice before his death as Molly, has found the grave in the midst of a small forest where nature has been building a shrine of black roses around Molly’s grave.  They send the thief on his way, yet again confused by the kindness of strangers, only to turn and see puffs of artron energy seeping out of Molly’s grave, having arrived as he is reborn yet again, still the same lavender Tiefling but the same mind as well, thanks to Caduceus’ spell that shielded him from his normal damaged regeneration powers.

This leaves Caduceus to leave the TARDIS and explore the world with Molly, stopping at every tea shop and bath house in all of Exandria that they can find, till eventually, having reunited with their friends and told many tales of their wandering years, The Master returns and frowns at them again, every time they try to leave Exandria they keep getting through around in time and always in a different part of either Molly or Caduceus’ lives so they decide to try to take them with them to see if they can make it out.  This plan almost works but they end up stranded in the distant past.  Caduceus, realizing they are in the forest he grew up in but there is no sign of the temple his family has guarded all these years. He does discover a young Firbolg woman who is in need of rescuing.

Caduceus falls in love, marries the woman and realizes that they found the temple to the Wild Mother and form the graveyard that he grows up in a long time from now.  Molly goes off to find supplies to try to help The Master, The Doctor, and The Corsair fix the TARDIS but as soon as he was far enough away the TARDIS is sling shot back into its own universe and timeline leaving Molly trapped in the ancient past.  He decides to commission an ancient wizard to write spells that Caleb will hunt for later when as a young child in the academy he discovers a smutty story that also has randomly hidden and encoded spells that only he seems to be able to decipher stored within their pages putting him on a lifelong quest to hunt for obscure works of pornography.

Molly continues to regenerate into himself at every death wondering how long he’ll be stuck in the past like this, till he meets the loves of his life and settles down in the temple with Caduceus’ great grand children and live his polyamorus omnisexual hedonistic life till one day he gives his life, one last time, to save a Firbolg woman who reminds him so much of his long departed friend.  This time, as he fades, he sees she’s mortally wounded and instead of regenerating himself he regenerates the woman, connecting with the young life growing in her and realizing that this is Caduceus’ mother with her unborn son inside her.  Molly dies, saving the life of his next host / incarnation, casting a reincarnation spell he’d been saving just in case he got tired of his current form, so that Caduceus would be born fresh, with none of The Master, Missy, or Molly’s baggage.

Caduceus is born later, growing up not only an innocent but new and fresh to the world with an old soul that lets him see the world in a way no one else can, and his parents never tell him much about his favorite grave, and the man buried there who saved his life.  This is the same grave that he goes to when he meets the Mighty Nein when they ask him to leave his home, taking a piece of Molly with him as he travels with Molly’s former friends, not knowing him by that name as he’d changed it long before Caduceus’ parents were born.  And when he stops and inspects Molly’s grave he senses the same energy from the grave he left behind, understanding that something has happened, either this being the same person in two graves or figuring this is somehow a child of the man he owes his life to, he charms the grave so that the earth will remember him.  Never knowing until much later in his life that he’s just started and closed a loop of his own life that will result in his own birth farther down the line.

trail.content_raw:
So I have this fan theory / head cannon that preys on my desire to make massive massively connected universes out of fandoms using the tiniest little tidbits to feed in one another and I have a theory about your characters I’ve seen you role play on Geek and Sundry.

Here is my fan theory: At the end of “The Doctor Falls” John Simm’s master doesn’t regenerate into Missy, in fact he regenerates into your Master from the Eric’s TBD Doctor Who RPG, who at the end of his regeneration becomes Michelle Gomaz’s Missy who dies at the end of “The Doctor Falls”, a small piece of her surviving in a ring that a Demon Lord, Nocticula, discovers when the Mondasian Colony ship fell out of a black hole into another universe where it crashed into Exandria.  Nocticula gave the ring to a mortal man she fell in love with for a brief time named Lord Percival Fredrickstein Von Musel Klossowski de Roll III of Whitestone, a ring he would later melt down for part of his famous invention shortly after they made love.  This released the Master/Missy’s soul which was captured by Nocticula and she used it to birth the Tiefling Lucien to whom she released into the world of Exandria.

Lucien, a Tiefling who had the soul of a Time Lord in his body, grew only to discover later that his Time Lord heritage was corrupted by jumping realties and rebirth by demon, has resulted in the ability to regenerate his mind and personality but not changing his body.  This allows him to die to become Nonagon, and later die again to become Mollymauk Tealeaf, who was valiantly struck down by the Oni Lorenzo in “Found and Lost”. Who’s body was lain to rest in the North, which the Mighty Nein visited, with the Firbolg, Caduceus Clay who would later cast decompose upon Molly’s remains so that the earth would remember him.

Caduceus leaves on with the Mighty Nein, having many grand adventures till he eventually gets hit with a bolt of time magic when Caleb attempts to rewrite history, reacting with an unknown energy inside Caduceus that has always allowed him to interact with the world around him in an unusual way, launching him not just through time but space, landing him in the fountains at Cardiff Bay’s Mermaid Quay, above the Torchwood Hub on the rift.  He leaves the fountain only to find a London Punk version of the Master fresh from his journey on the USS Sally Ride in “The Madwoman in a Box” finds him and frowns, realizing he knows him somehow and realizes much like on the Mondasian Colony ship, he’s found a future version of himself.

Taking Caduceus in the TARDIS of Amy Dallen’s Doctor, they travel through the rift, using Sam de Leve’s Rokokokoko’s abilities to navigate to a point of convergence between The Master and Caduceus, arriving in a frost covered mountain side, just as a well known thief who Molly had stopped and helped twice before his death as Molly, has found the grave in the midst of a small forest where nature has been building a shrine of black roses around Molly’s grave.  They send the thief on his way, yet again confused by the kindness of strangers, only to turn and see puffs of artron energy seeping out of Molly’s grave, having arrived as he is reborn yet again, still the same lavender Tiefling but the same mind as well, thanks to Caduceus’ spell that shielded him from his normal damaged regeneration powers.

This leaves Caduceus to leave the TARDIS and explore the world with Molly, stopping at every tea shop and bath house in all of Exandria that they can find, till eventually, having reunited with their friends and told many tales of their wandering years, The Master returns and frowns at them again, every time they try to leave Exandria they keep getting through around in time and always in a different part of either Molly or Caduceus’ lives so they decide to try to take them with them to see if they can make it out.  This plan almost works but they end up stranded in the distant past.  Caduceus, realizing they are in the forest he grew up in but there is no sign of the temple his family has guarded all these years. He does discover a young Firbolg woman who is in need of rescuing.

Caduceus falls in love, marries the woman and realizes that they found the temple to the Wild Mother and form the graveyard that he grows up in a long time from now.  Molly goes off to find supplies to try to help The Master, The Doctor, and The Corsair fix the TARDIS but as soon as he was far enough away the TARDIS is sling shot back into its own universe and timeline leaving Molly trapped in the ancient past.  He decides to commission an ancient wizard to write spells that Caleb will hunt for later when as a young child in the academy he discovers a smutty story that also has randomly hidden and encoded spells that only he seems to be able to decipher stored within their pages putting him on a lifelong quest to hunt for obscure works of pornography.

Molly continues to regenerate into himself at every death wondering how long he’ll be stuck in the past like this, till he meets the loves of his life and settles down in the temple with Caduceus’ great grand children and live his polyamorus omnisexual hedonistic life till one day he gives his life, one last time, to save a Firbolg woman who reminds him so much of his long departed friend.  This time, as he fades, he sees she’s mortally wounded and instead of regenerating himself he regenerates the woman, connecting with the young life growing in her and realizing that this is Caduceus’ mother with her unborn son inside her.  Molly dies, saving the life of his next host / incarnation, casting a reincarnation spell he’d been saving just in case he got tired of his current form, so that Caduceus would be born fresh, with none of The Master, Missy, or Molly’s baggage.

Caduceus is born later, growing up not only an innocent but new and fresh to the world with an old soul that lets him see the world in a way no one else can, and his parents never tell him much about his favorite grave, and the man buried there who saved his life.  This is the same grave that he goes to when he meets the Mighty Nein when they ask him to leave his home, taking a piece of Molly with him as he travels with Molly’s former friends, not knowing him by that name as he’d changed it long before Caduceus’ parents were born.  And when he stops and inspects Molly’s grave he senses the same energy from the grave he left behind, understanding that something has happened, either this being the same person in two graves or figuring this is somehow a child of the man he owes his life to, he charms the grave so that the earth will remember him.  Never knowing until much later in his life that he’s just started and closed a loop of his own life that will result in his own birth farther down the line.

Caduceus leaves on with the Mighty Nein, having many grand adventures till he eventually gets hit with a bolt of time magic when Caleb attempts to rewrite history, reacting with an unknown energy inside Caduceus that has always allowed him to interact with the world around him in an unusual way, launching him not just through time but space, landing him in the fountains at Cardiff Bay’s Mermaid Quay, above the Torchwood Hub on the rift.  He leaves the fountain only to find a London Punk version of the Master fresh from his journey on the USS Sally Ride in “The Madwoman in a Box” finds him and frowns, realizing he knows him somehow and realizes much like on the Mondasian Colony ship, he’s found a future version of himself.

Taking Caduceus in the TARDIS of Amy Dallen’s Doctor, they travel through the rift, using Sam de Leve’s Rokokokoko’s abilities to navigate to a point of convergence between The Master and Caduceus, arriving in a frost covered mountain side, just as a well known thief who Molly had stopped and helped twice before his death as Molly, has found the grave in the midst of a small forest where nature has been building a shrine of black roses around Molly’s grave.  They send the thief on his way, yet again confused by the kindness of strangers, only to turn and see puffs of artron energy seeping out of Molly’s grave, having arrived as he is reborn yet again, still the same lavender Tiefling but the same mind as well, thanks to Caduceus’ spell that shielded him from his normal damaged regeneration powers.

This leaves Caduceus to leave the TARDIS and explore the world with Molly, stopping at every tea shop and bath house in all of Exandria that they can find, till eventually, having reunited with their friends and told many tales of their wandering years, The Master returns and frowns at them again, every time they try to leave Exandria they keep getting through around in time and always in a different part of either Molly or Caduceus’ lives so they decide to try to take them with them to see if they can make it out.  This plan almost works but they end up stranded in the distant past.  Caduceus, realizing they are in the forest he grew up in but there is no sign of the temple his family has guarded all these years. He does discover a young Firbolg woman who is in need of rescuing.

Caduceus falls in love, marries the woman and realizes that they found the temple to the Wild Mother and form the graveyard that he grows up in a long time from now.  Molly goes off to find supplies to try to help The Master, The Doctor, and The Corsair fix the TARDIS but as soon as he was far enough away the TARDIS is sling shot back into its own universe and timeline leaving Molly trapped in the ancient past.  He decides to commission an ancient wizard to write spells that Caleb will hunt for later when as a young child in the academy he discovers a smutty story that also has randomly hidden and encoded spells that only he seems to be able to decipher stored within their pages putting him on a lifelong quest to hunt for obscure works of pornography.

Molly continues to regenerate into himself at every death wondering how long he’ll be stuck in the past like this, till he meets the loves of his life and settles down in the temple with Caduceus’ great grand children and live his polyamorus omnisexual hedonistic life till one day he gives his life, one last time, to save a Firbolg woman who reminds him so much of his long departed friend.  This time, as he fades, he sees she’s mortally wounded and instead of regenerating himself he regenerates the woman, connecting with the young life growing in her and realizing that this is Caduceus’ mother with her unborn son inside her.  Molly dies, saving the life of his next host / incarnation, casting a reincarnation spell he’d been saving just in case he got tired of his current form, so that Caduceus would be born fresh, with none of The Master, Missy, or Molly’s baggage.

Caduceus is born later, growing up not only an innocent but new and fresh to the world with an old soul that lets him see the world in a way no one else can, and his parents never tell him much about his favorite grave, and the man buried there who saved his life.  This is the same grave that he goes to when he meets the Mighty Nein when they ask him to leave his home, taking a piece of Molly with him as he travels with Molly’s former friends, not knowing him by that name as he’d changed it long before Caduceus’ parents were born.  And when he stops and inspects Molly’s grave he senses the same energy from the grave he left behind, understanding that something has happened, either this being the same person in two graves or figuring this is somehow a child of the man he owes his life to, he charms the grave so that the earth will remember him.  Never knowing until much later in his life that he’s just started and closed a loop of his own life that will result in his own birth farther down the line.

summary: Sometime this month I’m gonna see and hear my boy Scanlan again, and it makes me very happy. (I mean, I'm probably going to cry...

Sometime this month I’m gonna see and hear my boy Scanlan again, and it makes me very happy.

(I mean, I’m probably going to cry as soon as I hear any of VM’s voices regardless of whether it’s my boy Scanlan, let’s be fucking real.)

blog.name: c-is-for-circinate
blog.title: Only happy when it's complicated...
blog.description:
I'm C, which stands for a wide variety of things, including but not limited to 'coiled in a spiral with the tip hidden at the center'.  Take that metaphor as you will.

I like liking things.  I also like writing things and knitting things.  Sometimes I write things about TV shows I wish I didn't like.  Sometimes I don't like much of anything in the whole universe, and we have a Bad Brains day around here and that is fine.  Sometimes I just reblog a lot of posts about yarn.

summary: Aaaaaaand we have reached the exciting point in the timeline of any brand new series marathon where dashboard posts that were...
body:
Aaaaaaand we have reached the exciting point in the timeline of any brand new series marathon where dashboard posts that were all so much gibberish to me a week ago now magically become terrible spoilers that cannot be skimmed past.


Time to blacklist all variations on Critical Role I can think of, and binge as fast as I possibly can.

summary: I haven’t seen people asking in a while, but back when Campaign 2 started I saw a lot of people wondering what resources Liam...
body:
I haven’t seen people asking in a while, but back when Campaign 2 started I saw a lot of people wondering what resources Liam used to learn accents (because he does them a lot and commits to them so fully).

I couldn’t sleep the other night and was tumbling through youtube watching CritRole adjacent videos and stumbled on Liam’s episode of Marisha’s old G&S show “Signal Boost.”

The whole thing is worth a watch but three and a half minutes in he boosts the “International Dialects of English Archive,” an online database where you can listen to real people speak and read books aloud in various regional dialects of English from all over the world. (In a weird moment of foreshadowing: “Germany alone has 20 different samples, it is the best!”) Seems pretty neat! Just in case anyone was interested.
